parameters.name: --query-string

data.name: importXlsxFile
data.label: Import Excel File
data.description: Imports a .xlsx file from an online resource given its url.

parameters.name: --query-string
parameters.label: Query string
parameters.description: Query string to be added to the URL

parameters.name: --rename
parameters.label: Rename to
parameters.description: Rename the file to the given name

contributor.affiliation: Antonio Benítez Hidalgo; Khaos Research Group

parameters.name: --header
parameters.label: header
parameters.description: If the first row of the file is a header

parameters.name: --output-path
parameters.label: Output path
parameters.description: Path to the output CSV file

data.name: JoinDataset
data.label: Join Dataset
data.description: Join two csv datasets using columns as keys.

parameters.name: --first-file-path
parameters.label: First filepath
parameters.description: File path of the first file

parameters.name: --index-column-first-file
parameters.label: First column name to merge
parameters.description: Name of the column of the first file. This will be use for merge datasets using index column as keys

parameters.name: --second-file-path
parameters.label: Second filepath
parameters.description: File path of the second file

parameters.name: --index-column-second-file
parameters.label: Second column name to merge
parameters.description: Name of the column of the second file. This will be use for merge datasets using index column as keys

parameters.name: --join-how-parameter
parameters.label: How handle join operation
parameters.description: How to handle the operation of the two objects. left (DEFAULT): use calling frame’s index (or column if on is specified.) right: use other’s index. outer: form union of calling frame’s index (or column if on is specified) with other’s index, and sort it. lexicographically. inner: form intersection of calling frame’s index (or column if on is specified) with other’s index, preserving the order of the calling’s one.

data.name: llu
data.label: LLU
data.description: Calculates the Liquid Limit Update (LLU) using an input CSV file containing essential meteorological data. The script utilizes parameters such as useful rainfall (ru) and the name of the Evapotranspiration (ETP) variable to perform the calculation

data.name: inf
data.label: INF
data.description: Calculate infiltration from an input CSV file.

data.name: precipitationcdfmlot
data.label: Precipitation CDFM Plot
data.description: From the input CSV file, this component is responsible for plotting the deviation of precipitation accumulated per year in a graph.

data.name: etpplot
data.label: ETP Plot
data.description: From the input CSV file, this component is responsible for plotting the evapotranspiration per day on a graph.

data.name: monthlyprecipitationplot
data.label: Monthly Precipitation Plot
data.description: From the input CSV file, this component is in charge of plotting the precipitation grouped by month on a graph.

data.name: precipitationplot
data.label: Precipitation Plot
data.description: From the input CSV file, this component is responsible for plotting the precipitation per day on a graph.

data.name: precipitationseriesplot
data.label: Precipitation Series Plot
data.description: From the input CSV file, this component is responsible for plotting different measures (ETP, LLU, INF, ESC) by year on a graph.

data.name: temperatureplot
data.label: Temperature Plot
data.description: From the input CSV file, this component is responsible for plotting the maximum and minimum temperature per day on a graph.

data.name: ETPHamon
data.label: ETP Hamon
data.description: Hamon calculation method for estimating evapotranspiration from an input CSV file.

parameters.name: --k
parameters.label: K
parameters.description: Parameter necessary to calculate ETP Hamo
